messages.subject: re: Crass Commercial Message
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry, folks... The Gassan books are no more. Best, Andres ... Hey, folks... I have 5 copies up for grabs of: JAPANESE MASTER SWORDSMITHS: THE GASSAN TRADITION
messages.messageBody:
Sorry, folks... The Gassan books are no more.

Best,

Andres

-----------------------------------
Hey, folks...

I have 5 copies up for grabs of:

JAPANESE MASTER SWORDSMITHS:
THE GASSAN TRADITION
Morihiro OGAWA (1989)

They are new, but have been on a shelf for a while. Slight shelf
damage as a result. Nothing major, and certainly nothing affecting
the content, text, images, pages, etc. Minor creasing on cover at
worst. This is the Boston Museum of Fine Arts catalog on their Gassan
Exhibition in the '80's, where Gassan-san himself attended and forged
a sword for the event. Very nice plates and info.

I figured I'd give you guys a shot before I put them on eBay or
something. I'm asking $75 a copy, and I'll ship for free within the
U.S., actual shipping charges otherwise. Paypal or deposit to my
Wachovia account (if that bank still exists by the time you read this
message) will be fine.

Let me know...

Best,

Andres

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Crass Commercial Message
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All Have a few things for sale and like to give the list a crack at em. 1st is a very fine Kyo Sukashi tsuba for sale. I did my best to post of pic of it
messages.messageBody:
Hi All
Have a few things for sale and like to give the list a crack at 'em.

1st is a very fine Kyo Sukashi tsuba for sale. I did my best to post
of pic of it in the FILE section. If you can't find it, please let
me know. It is katana size tsuba (8 cm high by 7.9 cm wide and .4
cm thick). I am fairly certain that it is from the early Edo period
but I am not an expert so I can't guarantee that dating. I leave it
to the buyer to make their own determination on its exact age but I
am quite sure that it is no later than Mid Edo period.
The theme is of a chrysanthemum and the sukashi workmanship is
excellent. The color is a deep, dark brown and black. The patina is
rich, glossy and smooth. The marks on the seppa dai are intentional
and are a "signature" of sorts left by the smith who made it. The
only damage is some light pitting to the rim. There are a few rust
spots on the rim that could be improved with boning but overall
there is nothing to do but enjoy this tsuba! It comes in a fancy
Japanese wooden box that is lined with brocade fabric. I am sure you
will be happy with it.
Email me at kirk-becky@... for more info and pics.
PRICE $895

I also have listed a kozuka, FK and set of menuki on EBAy- all are
signed and very nice.
See the links below to view or search under my handle revkirk. I
will consider sellling them offline to list members.

http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dllViewItem&ih=018&item=280033191663
&rd=1&sspagename=STRK%3AMESE%3AIT&rd=1

http://cgi.ebay.com/Fine-Menuki-Signed-Goto-Etsujo-for
Tanto_W0QQitemZ280033193052QQihZ018QQcategoryZ73466QQssPageNameZWDVWQ
QrdZ1QQcmdZViewItem

http://cgi.ebay.com/Extraordinary-Japanese-Sword-Kozuka-Signed-Goto-
Hojo_W0QQitemZ280033194077QQihZ018QQcategoryZ73466QQssPageNameZWDVWQQ
rdZ1QQcmdZViewItem

I also have a years worth of NTHK journals Token To Rekishi (all in
Japanese) from the non-Yoshikawa group. They run from late 2001 to
November 2002. $25 ppd in the USA
Also a Christies Catalog from the Sword Museum Sale (#2) from March
29 of 2005- $20 PPD in the USA

Thanks for your time and bandwidth!
Kirk

messages.subject: Re: Crass Commercial Message
messages.msgSnippet: No, I have Haynes notes in Lundgren s copy of the Kakudaifu.  They are mostly reserved to attributions by Torigoye as to first, second, some references to
messages.messageBody:
No, I have Haynes notes in Lundgren's copy of the Kakudaifu. They
are mostly reserved to attributions by Torigoye as to first, second,
some references to which collection the piece came from, and a few
fake, etc. I believe he transcribed them from his own copy for
Lundgren and were notes he took from Torigoye. That book will be
available after I'm gone which is usually being arranged by several
folks at any given time so you probably won't have to wait long(LOL)!

PS: No.


--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "David Zincavage" <jdz@u...>

> This is the original, first edition Japanese printing of
the 'Nakamura Kakudaifu Nobuie Tsuba Shu' by Akiyama, Kyusaku, 1926,
Tokyo, or, 'Collection of Rubbings of the Nobuie Sword Guards
belonging to Nakamura'. This is printed in the Japanese acordion
folded sewn binding style and is practically flawless with age
related soiling to the cover (see pic) with both cover fasteners
intact. The interior book is 'Fine'. I have only seen two copies
available in the last four years and this is one. The text is of
course in Japanese but the rubbings are the primary source for study
of the Shodai and Nidai Nobuie tsuba, not the later reproductions. I
will be happy to include a transcription of the Haynes notes from his
study with Dr. Torigoye as to the generation/etc. for each page where
noted in the Lundgren copy. 144 pgs. A most rare book.

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Crass Commercial Message
messages.msgSnippet: Are you referring to part of the translation of Torigoe Kazutarô: Tsuba Geijutsu Kô, 2 vol, 144p+111P, Nihon Bunkyô, Okayama, 1960. published by the NCJSC
messages.messageBody:
Are you referring to part of the translation of
Torigoe Kazutarô: Tsuba Geijutsu Kô, 2 vol, 144p+111P, Nihon Bunkyô, Okayama, 1960. published by the NCJSC as Tsuba:An Aesthetic Study? or to other notes?



David Zincavage



--------------------------------

This is the original, first edition Japanese printing of the 'Nakamura Kakudaifu Nobuie Tsuba Shu' by Akiyama, Kyusaku, 1926, Tokyo, or, 'Collection of Rubbings of the Nobuie Sword Guards belonging to Nakamura'. This is printed in the Japanese acordion folded sewn binding style and is practically flawless with age related soiling to the cover (see pic) with both cover fasteners intact. The interior book is 'Fine'. I have only seen two copies available in the last four years and this is one. The text is of course in Japanese but the rubbings are the primary source for study of the Shodai and Nidai Nobuie tsuba, not the later reproductions. I will be happy to include a transcription of the Haynes notes from his study with Dr. Torigoye as to the generation/etc. for each page where noted in the Lundgren copy. 144 pgs. A most rare book.
----- Original Message -----
From: klepet33319
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, January 22, 2006 5:28 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Crass Commercial Message


I have listed several very hard to come by books on fittings and one on
Bizen smiths. Please take a look if interested and thank you for the
bandwidth!
Pete Klein
http://search.ebay.com/_W0QQsassZklepet33319QQhtZ-1

messages.subject: Crass Commercial Message
messages.msgSnippet: All, I have updated the Kodogu boxes page, we had a good run on them and moved all the Large and daisho boxes as well as quite a few of the regular tsuba boxes
messages.messageBody:
All, I have updated the Kodogu boxes page, we had a good run on them and
moved all the Large and daisho boxes as well as quite a few of the
regular tsuba boxes and a few of the other pieces.

I have updated the page with the remaining items and have linked it
below. We also have quite a few unfinished boxes and these are having
new silk pillows and linings made for them so please have a look back
from time to time if there is something you are after, or just contact
me and I will try and arrange something for you.

Thanks for the band width.

Rich Turner

http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/sale/Kodogu_Boxes/Kodogu_Boxes.html

messages.subject: Crass Commercial Message
messages.msgSnippet: All, I have listed an excellent Shinshinto Katana for a friend. The sword is attributed to Hamabe Toshinori and is in excellent polish, it has Koshirae and
messages.messageBody:
All, I have listed an excellent Shinshinto Katana for a friend. The
sword is attributed to Hamabe Toshinori and is in excellent polish, it
has Koshirae and Shirasaya. The Sword has NTHK Kanteisho and the Tsuba
has an older NBTHK Tokubetsu Kicho paper attributing it to the Soyo Den.
Please follow the link below. I hope you enjoy.

Thanks for looking

Rich Turner

Hamabe Katana
<http://members.westnet.com.au/whiz/richard/Nihonto_Sales_Board/Hamabe/HAMABE_Katana.htm>

http://members.westnet.com.au/whiz/richard/Nihonto_Sales_Board/Hamabe/HAMABE_Katana.htm
